respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare , edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

Â© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

sourceDesc.p: The Wordhoard Shakespeare is derived from, but not identical with, The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare (1891-3) edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright.

castItem.roleDesc: son to Vincentio, in love with Bianca
a gentleman of Verona, a suitor to Katharina
And Servants attending on Baptista and Petruchio

div.head: Induction, Scene 1
div.stage: Before an alehouse on a heath.

sp.speaker: Sly
sp.stage: Enter a LORD from hunting, with his train.

l.stage: Some bear out Sly. A trumpet sounds.

div.head: Induction, Scene 2
div.stage: A bedchamber in the LORD's house.
Enter aloft SLY, with Attendants; some with apparel, others with basin and ewer and other appurtenances; and Lord.

l.stage: Enter the Page as a lady, with attendants.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter LUCENTIO and his man TRANIO.

l.stage: Enter BAPTISTA, KATHARINA, BIANCA, GREMIO, and HORTENSIO. LUCENTIO and TRANIO stand by.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter PETRUCHIO and his man GRUMIO.

l.stage: He wrings him by the ears.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 1
div.stage: Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

l.stage: Enter GREMIO, LUCENTIO in the habit of a mean man; PETRUCHIO, with HORTENSIO as a musician; and TRANIO, with BIONDELLO bearing a lute and books.
Exit Servant, with Lucentio and Hortensio, Biondello following
Re-enter HORTENSIO, with his head broke.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter BAPTISTA, GREMIO, TRANIO, KATHARINA, BIANCA, LUCENTIO, and others, attendants.

l.stage: Exit weeping, followed by Bianca and others.
Re-enter PETRUCHIO, KATHARINA, BIANCA, BAPTISTA, HORTENSIO, GRUMIO, and Train.
Throws the meat, c. about the stage.
Enter PETRUCHIO and HORTENSIO with meat.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 4
div.stage: Enter TRANIO, and the Pedant dressed like VINCENTIO.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 5
div.stage: Enter PETRUCHIO, KATHARINA, HORTENSIO, and Servants.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 1
div.stage: GREMIO discovered. Enter behind BIONDELLO, LUCENTIO, and BIANCA.

l.stage: Enter PETRUCHIO, KATHARINA, VINCENTIO, GRUMIO, with Attendants.

sp.speaker: Gremio
sp.stage: Pedant looks out of the window.

sp.speaker: Petruchio
sp.stage: Re-enter Pedant below; TRANIO, BAPTISTA, and Servants.

sp.speaker: Vincentio
sp.stage: Re-enter BIONDELLO, with LUCENTIO and BIANCA.

l.stage: Exeunt Biondello, Tranio, and Pedant, as fast as may be.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter BAPTISTA, VINCENTIO, GREMIO, the Pedant, LUCENTIO, BIANCA, PETRUCHIO, KATHARINA, HORTENSIO, and Widow, TRANIO, BIONDELLO, and GRUMIO: the servingmen with Tranio bringing in a banquet.

l.stage: Re-enter KATHARINA, with BIANCA and Widow
